hmmm... no sabia si reseñar esta pero, es half life, eso significa que es god? obvio, pero no es el mejor, literal acabo de salirme porque me enoje jugandolo pero la verdad es bueno y divertido, siento que se siente diferente porque no consigues armas especiales, algunas cosas malas son los P U Z Z L E S, hay 2 que son muy injustos y uno me lo pase a la primera pero el otro asta encontre un secreto pensando que era la solucion, y tambien en la parte cerca en la que mori haciendo full juego no morir, habian como 3 militares con granadas de SMG, y estaba en un espacio cerrado y no podia asomarme o me lanzaban granadas, pero esta bien, podrias hacer algunas cosas como pasartelo de una sin saber como es el juego, pasartelo de una sin morir, o incluso pasarte el juego completo usando solo pistola

Pretty good, if you really need more Half Life in your life, this is a great play. It's short, but a great play and faithful to the first game, which is nice seeing as this is not made by valve. Absolutely recommend.

Oh, and if you do want to get it, I would say buy the Half Life 1 Anthology bundle. I got it, and it was great. Worth every cent.

Highly underrated, short and fun Half-Life experience. Definitely worth a play if you haven't already. You also gotta remember this was meant to be for the Dreamcast port of Half-Life, which is why it doesn't take long to finish.

Meu favorito dentre os 2 spin-offs do Half-Life! É bem mais curtinho que o Opposing Forces, mas muito mais charmoso. O começo é um dos melhores entre os 3 até, a quantidade de detalhe com tanto pouco polígono é absurda, mais outro lado dos eventos que ocorreram em Black Mesa, e super divertido pra quem acabou de jogar os outros dois. Recomendo muito!

It's not Half Life, but I didn't want it to be. I liked most of it and I could have done without the Xen level because this is Barney, not Gordon and it's true that it's shorter but I liked it in the context of the story. If I had wanted to play Half Life I would have played Half Life, this was different, it felt like another story in the same place and time and it was a small story in that place and time but I liked it.

Half Life: Blue Shift is a very short and somewhat fun addon to the original Half Life, or rather I would say that if I had a Dreamcast version of the game but on Steam this is an individual game and therefore I don’t think it’s worth playing through. Since the game is so short and built around the limited capabilities of the Dreamcast, we don’t have a wide range of different weapons as in Opposing Forces and since this game was released after the release of Opposing Forces everyone (the player) has much less to work with than what they’re used to.

Don’t get me wrong, the game isn’t bad per se - the fact that we get to see Gordon and everyone else all around the game is great and since they made a success with the original Half Life the story is much well organised and showcased than before however, this game alone isn’t worth going through.

If it was an addon just like in the Dreamcast version I’d be okay with this, the fact that something so small wouldn’t have a price in the original game I wouldn’t mind just talking about the positives but since this is its own game and the fact that it doesn’t have the same Half Life polish we’re used to, it’s not worth it.
It wasn't too bad, but definitely the worst Half Life.

This was fucking great, I've always wanted to finish it but never did, always stayed playing up to a certain point, got bored, and moved along.

Until one day, about two days ago as a matter of fact; I decided to change my approach towards this game, mainly because I was still interested in playing it, completing it, and enjoying it.

I went and played through it on "normal" were as before, all of my attempts were done on "easy" this was mainly because I've been rethinking my approach to game difficulty and also the fact that I've noticed I enjoyed much more when games actually set a default level of difficulty for me that I can't change, think of the original Hitman 2016, Binding of Isaac (the original & rebirth), or more recently, Deathloop which I've love playing.

The experiment worked. Not only did I not found Blue Shift that difficult on "normal" but I also loved the game, completed all the way through this time around, in two sessions no less, it wasn't that long of a game, but it was the perfect length for the kind of game I was looking forward to.

As for the game?

Blue Shift is Half Life but you play as Calhougn, Calgouhn? I don't know; look! you are one of the officers trying to escape the facility, throughout the game you'll go through a multitude of different set pieces, gunfights and more.

You'll battle aliens, marines, and even like in the original Half Life game, at one point and time you'll even abandon earth to go different alien dimensions similarly to how you did at the end of the original game.

Is all well and good though, the game is perfectly well balanced and frankly, the only there were only two small parts that really bothered me about the game... well three, if you count some bugs here and there.

The first part was when you visit the alternate, alien, Xen dimension, the game developers went out of their ways to implement some pretty annoying platforming; is a short area, but an annoying one at that.

Then there's the freaking level design and puzzle design at times; there's a point were I got lost near the start of the game because I couldn't find a ladder that was placed in the worse place it could be; literally a place where not only did the ladder  camouflaged with the tank in was placed on because of its colour; but also it was placed exactly in the one part where you wouldn't look because of the game's narrow fov and quick camera movement & angle.

As for the puzzles?

There was only one fairly near the end of the game that pissed me off; there's a bunch of dynamite planted on a door that you're supposed to blow up, this dynamite is connected to a trigger but there's a problem.

The cable is connected with? broken! now how the fuck do I attach it?

Welp, it turns out I wasn't supposed to attach it at all, instead what I was supposed to do, was get a barrel from a corner of the same room, drag it to complete the missing link between the two cables, and then somehow trigger the freaking thing.

This made me lose about 15 minutes or so while I was exploring the same areas trying to find a solution as to where to go, or what to do; it got pretty annoying.

On the plus side there was an IGN guide that was actually quite good for once and I enjoyed both reading it as well as using it to complete the game, despite not really needing it after this "barrel" puzzle.

Other than that the game is what you would expect, it plays like Half Life, it looks like Half Life, the soldiers that you run into are a bunch of assholes, and the scientists and aliens are all cool.

Generally it's a great recommendation, and probably the first Half Life game of the classic trilogy that I've actually completed through and enjoyed at its fullest.

Now if you'll excuse me, I'll experiment once more, by playing through the other two classic Half Life titles on "normal" or harder.

Obviamente, não poderia faltar o ponto de vista de um guarda comum do complexo Black Mesa. É o mais curto em comparação aos outros e não chega a oferecer os mesmos momentos de tensão (até porque é um guarda comum do complexo e não um cabo do exército ou um funcionário de alto escalão como o Freeman). Mas são horas de diversão garantida!

Good short three hour game, people's biggest problem with this game seems to be it's lack of content compared to Opposing Force, I do agree with people who say this, but for new fans, like myself, this is best played before Opposing Force, unless you want to be disappointed by it. It's a lot shorter than Half-Life 1, lacks most of it's weapons, and looks awful with or without HD models, but I think it's pretty good for people who don't wanna start at Half-Life 1 or just want a quick extra few levels.

Half-Life 1 oyununu Morgan Freeman gözünden oynamıştık. Bu eklenti paketinde ise Freeman ile oynarken her yerde gördüğümüz güvenlik görevlilerinden birinin o meşhur kasırga yaşanmadan önce ve yaşandıktan sonra neler yaşadığını görüyor, hikayesini öğreniyoruz. Half-Life oyununda ne varsa bu oyunda da aynı şeyler var, herhangi bir yenilik yok. Bu yüzden hikayesi hakkında konuşmak daha doğru olur. Kısa ve öz bir hikayesi var, ben oldukça beğendim. Bu kadar :D
круто

«Blue Shift» is a really good example of that when expansions were like a whole game.

It's a link between «Half Life» and «Half-Life 2». Here we get to know Barney, who will play a key role in the second part of the game. He is the only one who was able to get out of «Black Mesa» and was not put in stasis by G-Man.

Oyun güzel. İndirim zamanı tüm paket (half life, blue shift, opposing force, team fortress classic) 7tl'ye denk geliyor. Half Life'ı sevdiyseniz bunu da seveceğinizi garanti ederim. Oyun güzel, doların bu kadar yüksek olduğu şu zamanda 7tl'yi kesinlikle hak ediyor.

Oyunun tek eksi yanı eski olması. Mekanikleri açısından halen oynanabilir ama crossair'i görmek aşırı zor. Bunda sıkıntı yaşamazsanız başka bir eksi tarafını göremezsiniz. Şu ana kadar oynamadıysanız tavsiye edilir.

DEVAMI SPOİLER İÇERİR
Half Life'ı oynamamış olsaydım sonunda depresif hissedecektim :P Gordon'un askerler tarafından götürülmesini görüyoruz son sahnede ama biz kaçıyoruz.

This is a good expansion pack for Half-Life, but it's too short. It's not bad, but it could've been longer. It doesn't feature any new weapons or enemies, but it's still an interesting story. You still get to explore new areas of Black Mesa, plus you get to explore a new area of Xen. Overall, this game is good, but not as good as Opposing Force, the other expansion pack.
